Articles.Content:
In a devnote a few months back, they mentioned something about kerbals being able to grab onto edges of objects.

Is this actually in? (I'm in school ATM, so I don't have access to it.)

I don't get the relationship to parkour

"Kerbals can now clamber onto ledges."

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116772-Congrats-to-Squad](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116772-Congrats-to-Squad)

> 
> I don't get the relationship to parkour
> "Kerbals can now clamber onto ledges."
> 
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116772-Congrats-to-Squad](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116772-Congrats-to-Squad)

Like jumping from ledges and landing on something else.
No. Kerbals can now climb onto something (small) without ladders. Flags for example ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> No. Kerbals can now climb onto something (small) without ladders. Flags for example ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Aw. So no jumpy and landy?

I wanted to have Jeb and Valentina have a race :3
It's only Kerbal Parkour if it happens on the Mun.
It's only Kerbal Parkour if rocket packs are involved.

> 
> it's only kerbal parkour if rocket packs are involved **on the Mun**.

ftfy. 

=d

> 
> Aw. So no jumpy and landy?
> I wanted to have Jeb and Valentina have a race :3

Kerbals have been able to jump for a while. Perhaps not to parkour standards, though.
Does this clamber fix the last step issue of a ladder to top and they can't climb on top?

> 
> Does this clamber fix the last step issue of a ladder to top and they can't climb on top?

It's supposed to. I'm downloading now. Will report in once installed.
